In the world, only the head is revered. As the ruler of the country, he is not the same as others.
The king then ordered his ministers to seek out the head of a dead person, as well as the heads of cows, horses, pigs, and sheep.
The ministers then went everywhere to search for them. After several days, they obtained them and returned to report to the king, saying:
Previously, we were ordered to seek the head of a dead person and the heads of the six domestic animals. We have now obtained them all.
The king said:
Sell them in the market.
The ministers then had people sell them. The heads of cows, horses, pigs, and sheep were all sold, but only the human heads had not been sold.
The king said:

In this way, after several days, the sale was still not sold, and no one took them when given away. The heads all became swollen and stinking, and no one could approach them.
The king became very angry and said to the ministers:

The king then ordered the ministers to prepare the carriage, and they were about to go out to the wilderness outside the city to ask about something.
The ministers and people were all trembling with fear, not knowing what the king was thinking.
The king then led the procession out of the city and told the ministers:
Do you recognize the little boy who always held an umbrella for my late father?
The ministers replied:
We do indeed recognize him.
The king said:
Where is that boy now?
They replied:
He has been dead for a long time, already seventeen years.
The king said:
How was that boy, good or evil?
They replied:
We have always seen him serving the late king, fasting and being respectful, sincerely faithful and self-disciplined, not speaking of what is unlawful.
The king told the ministers:
If you now see the clothes that boy wore when he was alive, would you recognize them?
The ministers replied:
Although it has been a long time, we still recognize them.
The king turned to his attendants and ordered them to quickly return to the treasury and fetch the clothes of the deceased boy.
Soon the clothes arrived, and the king said:
Is this it?
The ministers replied:
It really is his clothes.
The king said:
If I were to see my son's body now, would I recognize it?
The ministers all fell silent, and after a long while they replied:
We ourselves are afraid of being in the dark and suddenly not being able to distinguish it.

The king was about to tell them about the previous changes, when the monk they had seen earlier arrived. The king was overjoyed and rose, touching his head to the ground to pay homage to the monk. The ministers were all delighted.
The monk took a seat, and the king cupped his hands and said:
I previously suddenly saw a monk on the road, and followed him back, but was criticized and ridiculed by the ministers and officials, who advised me, saying:
'The head and face are the most honorable.
Moreover, as the ruler of a country, the lord of the myriad people, with the four directions turning towards you,
what do you seek or desire, to pay homage with your head and face to a begging monk?
I then ordered that the heads of the six domestic animals and human heads be sold together in the market.
The heads of the six domestic animals were all sold, but no one bought the human heads. Even the beggars did not take them, and the officials treasured them.
Now I have deliberately brought them out, also wanting to show their origins and ends.

If there is a fortunate one, I wish the Daoist to lower his dignity and be willing to open and guide the ignorant people of this country for the sake of the people, to make them know the true Dharma and guide them in the present.
The Daoist then spoke for the ministers about the king's past changes:

If you want to know the king, he was originally the little boy who held the parasol for the previous king. He always followed the previous king in observing the precepts for one day, practicing the right Dharma, purifying his thoughts, and not committing any evil.
After his death, his spirit was reborn and became the king's son.
Now he has attained nobility, all due to his past practice of observing the precepts.
The ministers, both high and low, all said in agreement:
We are fortunate to have encountered the Wayfarer. We wish that you would take pity on our ignorance and make us your disciples.
The Wayfarer told the ministers and people:
I have a great teacher, from whom I should receive instruction.
The ministers replied:
We wish to hear about your great teacher's practices.
We will devote our entire lives to him, hoping to personally serve him and receive his teachings.
The Wayfarer said:

My teacher is called the Buddha. His body can fly and his head has a round halo. He can split his body and manifest in myriad ways. How far is the Buddha from here now?
The monk replied,
It is over six thousand miles.
In an instant, the monk flew to the country of Sravasti and reported to the Buddha in detail,
The people of that country are truly pitiful. They now all sincerely wish to see the Buddha.
Please bestow your great compassion and reveal the true path.
